definition.text: Sub-group (4th level) for objects with complemental characteristics, without which the basic function of the objects classified under the parent-class on the 3rd level is still guaranteed

this classification encompasses receptacles specifically designed for the collection, storage, and transportation of urine samples, primarily used in in vitro diagnostics. These containers are engineered to maintain the integrity of the samples, ensuring that they remain uncontaminated and suitable for analysis. The classification distinguishes between containers that are sterile and non-sterile, catering to various testing requirements. The design and materials used in these containers are tailored to support safe handling and accurate sampling, facilitating reliable testing outcomes in medical and laboratory settings.

a type of container specifically designed for the collection and transportation of urine samples in in vitro diagnostics, characterized by the absence of sterility. These containers are utilized in various medical and laboratory settings to facilitate urine testing, ensuring that the samples can be safely handled and analyzed without contamination from external sources. They are typically constructed from materials that are resistant to chemical interactions with urine, allowing for accurate test results. Non-sterile urine containers are essential for routine urine analysis and can be used for a range of diagnostic purposes, providing healthcare professionals with a reliable method to obtain and store urine samples prior to laboratory examination.

a type of container specifically designed for the collection, storage, and transportation of urine samples in a sterile manner. These containers are utilized in in vitro diagnostic processes to ensure the integrity and contamination-free status of the specimen. They are engineered to meet stringent hygiene standards, often featuring sealed packaging and materials that prevent microbial growth. Their use is crucial in medical testing and analysis, where the accuracy of results depends on the absence of contaminants. This category is distinct from other containers that do not maintain sterile conditions, ensuring higher reliability in diagnostic outcomes.
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level
Sub-group (4th level) for objects with spare part characteristics that maintain or re-store the original condition of the objects classified under the parent-class on the 3rd level
Sub-group (4th level) for objects with complemental characteristics, without which the basic function of the objects classified under the parent-class on the 3rd level is still guaranteed

a type of receptacle specifically designed to hold and preserve samples for in vitro diagnostics while ensuring sterility. This container is engineered to minimize contamination risks during the handling, transport, and storage of samples that may be subject to biological hazards. It is distinct from other types of sample containers tailored for specific biological fluids or sample types. This classification encompasses containers that maintain aseptic conditions necessary for accurate testing and analysis, ensuring the integrity and safety of potentially contaminated samples. The design and materials used in these containers are intended to support laboratory protocols and regulatory requirements for handling hazardous biological materials.

preferred_name.label: Sterile container for potentially contaminated sample (IVD)

definition.text: a specialized container designed to securely hold and transport samples that may be contaminated, particularly in the context of in vitro diagnostics (IVD). This type of container ensures the integrity and safety of the samples during handling and analysis, minimizing the risk of contamination or exposure. It typically features sterilization processes and materials that prevent microbial growth while providing an airtight seal and appropriate labeling for biohazard identification. This classification emphasizes the necessity for stringent safety measures in the management of potentially hazardous biological materials, adhering to regulatory standards and best practices in laboratory environments.

Sub-group (4th level) for objects with spare part characteristics that maintain or re-store the original condition of the objects classified under the parent-class on the 3rd level
Sub-group (4th level) for objects with complemental characteristics, without which the basic function of the objects classified under the parent-class on the 3rd level is still guaranteed

preferred_name.label: Container for sample of human origin (IVD)

definition.text: a specific category that encompasses various types of receptacles designed for the secure collection, transport, and storage of biological samples derived from humans for in vitro diagnostic purposes. These containers are essential for maintaining the integrity and viability of human samples during handling and analysis. They are distinct from other categories that focus on specialized containers for specific types of biological fluids. The design and materials used in these receptacles ensure compatibility with laboratory processes and compliance with health and safety standards. This category plays a crucial role in the diagnostic workflow, facilitating accurate testing and analysis while minimizing contamination and sample degradation.

preferred_name.label: Container for sample of human origin (IVD, unspecified)

a naturally occurring steroid hormone, androstenedione plays a pivotal role in the biosynthesis of androgens and estrogens. It is primarily produced in the adrenal glands and gonads, and serves as a precursor for testosterone and estrone. This substance is significant in various physiological processes, including the regulation of reproductive functions and overall hormonal balance. In clinical settings, measurements of this hormone can assist in the assessment of disorders related to fertility, hormonal imbalances, and various endocrine conditions. Its specific classification within the broader category of fertility and pregnancy hormones highlights its relevance in reproductive health assessments and diagnostic procedures related to hormonal profiling.

a naturally occurring steroid hormone that is primarily produced by the adrenal glands and serves as a precursor in the biosynthesis of androgens and estrogens. This substance is involved in various physiological processes including the regulation of hormonal balance and the modulation of reproductive functions. Its measurement is often utilized in clinical settings for assessing adrenal function, fertility issues, and other hormonal disorders. The classification of this substance distinguishes it from other related hormones and proteins that play significant roles in fertility and pregnancy, reflecting its unique biochemical properties and clinical relevance.

Female sex hormone that is produced in the ovaries and is responsible for the regulation of reproduction and the development of sex-specific characteristics. It is used clinically to assess fertility and menopausal status.

a biologically active glycoprotein that plays a crucial role in the regulation of reproductive processes. It is produced by the anterior pituitary gland and is essential for the development of ovarian follicles in females. This hormone stimulates the growth and maturation of ovarian follicles, leading to the production of eggs. In males, it influences spermatogenesis by acting on the Sertoli cells in the testes. The measurement of this hormone is important in assessing fertility issues, hormonal imbalances, and various reproductive health conditions. It is frequently utilized in clinical diagnostics and therapeutic monitoring related to reproductive health.

luteinizing hormone is a glycoprotein hormone produced by the anterior pituitary gland, playing a crucial role in regulating reproductive processes. It is essential for the normal function of the ovaries and testes, stimulating ovulation in females and testosterone production in males. This hormone acts by binding to specific receptors on target cells, triggering a cascade of events that lead to reproductive hormone secretion. Measurement of luteinizing hormone levels is significant in the assessment of fertility issues, menstrual irregularities, and various endocrine disorders. Its role in the reproductive axis makes it a key marker for evaluating gonadal function and diagnosing conditions related to reproductive health.

this classification pertains to a specific category of substances that are crucial for reproductive health and hormonal balance, particularly in the context of in vitro diagnostics. The items in this category play significant roles in the regulation of various physiological processes related to fertility and pregnancy. They are utilized in medical testing and diagnostics to assess hormonal levels, monitor reproductive health, and aid in the diagnosis of various conditions. This classification is distinct from other related hormonal substances, emphasizing the unique biochemical properties and clinical applications associated with this particular compound. The focus is on substances that are specifically relevant to fertility and pregnancy, highlighting their importance in both diagnostic and therapeutic contexts.

a substance that plays a crucial role in the reproductive system, particularly in maintaining pregnancy and regulating various physiological processes related to fertility. This item is characterized by its hormonal activity and is involved in preparing the uterine lining for implantation, as well as supporting early stages of pregnancy. It is distinct from other hormones and proteins that are also associated with reproductive health, each having unique functions and indications. This substance may be utilized in various medical diagnostics and treatments related to fertility and pregnancy management.

a biochemical substance that is predominantly produced by the pituitary gland, playing a crucial role in regulating various physiological processes related to reproductive health. This substance is utilized in diagnostic applications to assess and monitor reproductive functions, fertility, and pregnancy status. Its measurement is essential for understanding hormonal balance and potential disorders associated with reproduction. This classification encompasses various assays and testing methodologies specifically designed for evaluating the levels of this hormone in biological samples. The substance is significant in both clinical and research settings, contributing to the advancement of reproductive health diagnostics.

a protein that specifically binds to sex hormones, playing a crucial role in regulating their availability and activity within the body. This biomolecule is involved in various physiological processes related to reproduction and hormonal balance. Its concentration can influence fertility and pregnancy outcomes, making it significant in clinical assessments related to these areas. The measurement of this protein can provide insights into hormonal status and potential reproductive health issues. It is distinct from other related proteins and hormones that play roles in fertility and pregnancy, each exhibiting unique functions and regulatory mechanisms.

a naturally occurring steroid hormone primarily produced in the testes, ovaries, and adrenal glands, playing a crucial role in the development and maintenance of male secondary sexual characteristics. It exists in various forms, including free testosterone and its more active metabolite, dehydrotestosterone. This hormone is vital for reproductive health and influences numerous physiological processes, including muscle mass, bone density, and fat distribution. In clinical settings, measurements of this hormone are essential for assessing fertility, hormonal imbalances, and other health-related issues. The classification of this hormone encompasses its various forms and their respective functions, differentiating it from other hormones involved in reproductive health and pregnancy.

a biologically active steroid hormone involved in various physiological processes, particularly in the context of reproductive health. This substance plays a crucial role in the regulation of reproductive functions and is often measured in clinical settings to assess hormonal balance and fertility. Its presence can be indicative of specific physiological states or conditions, facilitating the diagnosis of various reproductive disorders. This substance is typically analyzed in laboratory settings, particularly in in vitro diagnostics, to provide insights into hormonal levels and their implications for health.

androstanediol-glucuronide is a biochemical compound that serves as a metabolite of androgens, typically involved in various physiological processes related to hormone regulation and metabolism. This substance is primarily linked to the assessment of fertility and reproductive health, reflecting the body's hormonal balance and potential dysfunctions. Its measurement is significant in clinical diagnostics, particularly in evaluating conditions related to hormonal disorders and reproductive health issues. Androstanediol-glucuronide is distinguished from other related hormonal substances by its specific metabolic pathways and clinical implications, providing valuable insights into the endocrine system's functioning.

a naturally occurring steroid hormone involved in various physiological processes, particularly those related to the regulation of adrenal function and the reproductive system. It plays a crucial role in the body's response to stress and the maintenance of homeostasis. This compound is synthesized in the adrenal cortex and exhibits effects on metabolism, immune response, and electrolyte balance. Its measurement is significant in medical diagnostics, particularly in assessing adrenal gland activity and potential hormonal imbalances. This classification encompasses substances that share similar functional characteristics and applications in clinical settings, contributing to the understanding of hormonal regulation within the body.

a class of substances characterized by steroid hormones produced by the adrenal cortex, which play a crucial role in various physiological processes. These substances are involved in the regulation of metabolism, immune response, and stress response, and are also associated with reproductive functions. Their measurement is significant in clinical diagnostics, particularly in assessing adrenal function and related disorders. The class includes compounds that may exist in various forms, including those that are biologically active or inactive, and may have implications in both health and disease states. This classification encompasses diverse analytical methods for detection and quantification in laboratory settings.

a specific type of protein that is produced during pregnancy, often serving as a biomarker for various physiological states related to gestation. This protein plays a crucial role in the maintenance and progression of pregnancy by facilitating communication between the mother and the developing fetus. Its measurement can provide insights into potential complications or health issues during pregnancy. This category encompasses proteins that are not only essential for normal pregnancy outcomes but also serve as indicators of maternal and fetal well-being. It is distinct from other hormonal and protein classifications associated with fertility and pregnancy, highlighting its unique functions and significance in reproductive health.

a bioactive steroid hormone belonging to the category of reproductive and pregnancy-related substances. This specific compound is primarily involved in the regulation of various physiological processes related to female reproductive health, including the menstrual cycle and pregnancy. It is produced in significant amounts during pregnancy, playing a crucial role in maintaining the health of the fetus and supporting the development of placental tissues. This hormone is typically measured in clinical settings to assess and monitor reproductive health, fertility status, and the progression of pregnancy. Its analysis aids in diagnosing potential hormonal imbalances and evaluating the overall wellbeing of both the mother and the developing fetus.

a substance that is a naturally occurring estrogen and is primarily produced in the placenta during pregnancy. It plays a crucial role in maintaining pregnancy and supporting fetal development. This hormone exists in its unbound form, which is significant for various physiological processes. The measurement of this hormone can be important in assessing fetal well-being and placental function. It is distinct from other hormones involved in fertility and pregnancy, as it specifically reflects the hormonal status associated with the later stages of gestation. Its clinical applications may include monitoring high-risk pregnancies and evaluating potential complications related to hormone levels.

a biological substance that is classified under a specific category related to fertility and pregnancy, which is involved in various physiological processes. This substance plays a significant role in reproductive health, influencing hormonal balance and supporting pregnancy. It is distinct from other related substances in this category, each of which has unique functions and characteristics. This classification aids in the identification and understanding of the substance's purpose and application in medical diagnostics and treatment, particularly in assessing reproductive health and pregnancy status.

this category encompasses a biological substance produced during pregnancy that plays a crucial role in the maintenance of pregnancy and the development of fetal tissues. It is a glycoprotein hormone that is secreted by the placenta and serves to stimulate the production of progesterone, which is essential for sustaining the uterine lining and promoting fetal growth. The presence and levels of this substance can be indicative of pregnancy status and are often measured in clinical settings for various diagnostic purposes. This classification specifically differentiates it from other hormones and proteins associated with fertility and pregnancy by its unique biological function and production source.

a biological substance that is classified as a hormone produced during pregnancy, primarily by the placenta. This substance plays a crucial role in maintaining pregnancy and supporting fetal development by promoting hormone production and regulating various physiological processes. It may exist in various forms, including subunits, and is often measured in clinical settings to assess pregnancy health and related conditions. This classification encompasses a range of characteristics that distinguish it from other hormones and proteins associated with reproductive health and pregnancy monitoring. The substance is essential in the context of fertility treatments, pregnancy testing, and monitoring pregnancy progression and potential complications.

a naturally occurring protein produced by the placenta during pregnancy, known for its role in regulating maternal metabolism and supporting fetal growth. This substance is primarily involved in the modulation of insulin and glucose metabolism, contributing to the nutritional supply for the developing fetus. It also plays a part in the development of the mammary glands in preparation for lactation. The presence and levels of this protein in maternal serum can provide insights into various aspects of pregnancy health and fetal development, making it a significant biomarker in obstetrics and gynecology.

a specific type of biomolecule associated with pregnancy, primarily produced by the placenta, which plays a role in various physiological processes during gestation. This molecule is utilized in clinical diagnostics to assess pregnancy status and monitor fetal health. It is classified within a broader category of hormones and proteins that are critical to fertility and pregnancy, and it serves as a marker for certain conditions. This entity is distinct from other hormones and proteins in the same category, each possessing unique functions and implications in reproductive health.

a glycoprotein that consists of a protein component covalently bonded to carbohydrate moieties, typically involved in various biological functions related to fertility and pregnancy. This substance plays a crucial role in reproductive processes, influencing hormone activity and cellular signaling. It is characterized by its specific structure, which differentiates it from other hormones and proteins associated with reproductive health. Glycoproteins of this nature may be used in clinical diagnostics and therapeutic applications, serving as biomarkers or treatment agents in fertility management and pregnancy monitoring. Their detection and quantification can provide valuable insights into hormonal status and reproductive function.

this classification encompasses specific proteins that are associated with pregnancy and play a significant role in maternal and fetal health. The defined items within this category are characterized by their production during pregnancy and their relevance in various diagnostic and monitoring contexts. These proteins may serve as biomarkers for assessing pregnancy status, potential complications, or the overall health of the mother and fetus. They are utilized in medical testing and research to gain insights into reproductive health and pregnancy outcomes. The classification specifically distinguishes these proteins from other hormones and proteins related to fertility and pregnancy, highlighting their unique functions and clinical significance.

a substance that is involved in the physiological processes related to pregnancy, specifically associated with the development and regulation of placental function. This biomarker plays a crucial role in the assessment of maternal and fetal health, particularly in relation to conditions that can arise during pregnancy, such as pre-eclampsia. The presence and levels of this factor can provide insights into the placental development and the overall health of the pregnancy, serving as an important indicator for healthcare professionals in monitoring and managing pregnancy-related complications.

a biochemical substance involved in various physiological processes, including cell signaling and regulation of cellular activities, primarily associated with reproductive functions. This substance plays a critical role in the modulation of hormonal pathways and can influence fertility outcomes. It is characterized by its solubility and interaction with specific receptors, facilitating a range of biological responses. The classification encompasses elements that are vital for understanding reproductive health and hormonal balance, distinguishing itself from related substances that also impact fertility but operate through different mechanisms or pathways. This category serves as an essential reference for research and clinical applications related to reproductive endocrinology and related fields.

Sub-group (4th level) for objects with complemental characteristics, without which the basic function of the objects classified under the parent-class on the 3rd level is still guaranteed

this classification encompasses specialized receptacles designed for the collection, preservation, and transportation of biological samples utilized in laboratory diagnostics. These items are crucial for ensuring the integrity and reliability of samples taken for in-vitro testing purposes. The range includes containers specifically tailored for various types of specimens, such as those derived from blood, plasma, serum, and urine, as well as sterile options for safeguarding samples against contamination. This classification distinctly separates itself from related categories that focus on different diagnostic methodologies and instruments, emphasizing its unique role in the processing and handling of human-origin biological materials for diagnostic analysis.

preferred_name.label: Container for blood, plasma, and serum sample (IVD)

definition.text: a collection of specialized receptacles designed to securely hold and preserve biological fluid samples, specifically blood, plasma, and serum, for in vitro diagnostic purposes. These containers ensure the integrity and stability of the samples during transportation and storage, facilitating accurate analysis in laboratory settings. They are characterized by their compatibility with various anticoagulants, which help to prevent clotting and maintain the samples in a state suitable for testing. This classification encompasses a variety of tubes, each tailored for specific anticoagulant agents, ensuring optimal conditions for different diagnostic applications. The design and materials used in these containers prioritize sterility and reliability to meet the stringent requirements of medical laboratories.

a tubular container designed specifically for the collection, storage, and transportation of serum specimens without the presence of anticoagulants. This type of container is commonly utilized in in vitro diagnostic (IVD) procedures, ensuring that the serum remains unaltered for accurate testing and analysis. It is differentiated from other types of tubes that contain specific anticoagulants, which are used to prevent blood clotting during sample processing. This product is essential for laboratories and medical facilities that require reliable and standardized methods for serum sample handling.

this classification encompasses products designed for the qualitative and quantitative assessment of microbial organisms through single testing methodologies. These testing solutions facilitate the identification of specific bacteria and assess their susceptibility to various antimicrobial agents. Typically presented in formats such as discs, strips, or droppers, these items are essential for laboratory diagnostics, enabling healthcare professionals to make informed decisions regarding treatment options. The focus is on providing reliable results for clinical specimens, contributing to the effective management of infectious diseases by determining the presence and resistance patterns of targeted microorganisms.

a testing method used to identify specific types of bacteria by observing their reaction to a particular reagent applied on a slide. This approach is essential for determining the presence of certain bacterial strains within a sample, aiding in diagnosis and treatment decisions. The technique involves the application of a sample onto a specially designed slide, followed by the addition of reagents that react with target bacteria. Interpretation of the results is based on observable changes, enabling healthcare professionals to differentiate between various bacterial species. This method is especially valuable in clinical microbiology for its efficiency and specificity in identifying pathogens.

this classification pertains to diagnostic tests designed specifically for the identification and assessment of bacterial pathogens, particularly focusing on the Staphylococci species. The tests aim to detect the presence of these microorganisms in clinical specimens, helping in the diagnosis of infections. These tests are essential in microbiology laboratories and contribute to understanding the susceptibility of Staphylococci to various antimicrobial agents. The procedures involved typically include the use of specific reagents and methodologies that enable the differentiation of Staphylococci from other bacterial types, thereby facilitating targeted treatment strategies. The classification highlights the uniqueness of this test within a broader framework of bacteriological identification and susceptibility assessments.

a laboratory diagnostic tool designed for the identification of specific bacterial pathogens associated with meningitis. This testing method utilizes a slide format to facilitate the examination and differentiation of bacteria based on their unique characteristics. It is particularly focused on providing accurate identification to assist in clinical decision-making and treatment options for patients suspected of having meningitis. The test operates within a specialized framework that emphasizes the detection of relevant microorganisms while distinguishing itself from other methodologies aimed at identifying various bacterial species and their susceptibility profiles. This classification encompasses a broad range of applications within bacteriology, enhancing the capabilities of healthcare professionals in managing infectious diseases effectively.

this classification encompasses methods and techniques used for the identification and differentiation of specific bacterial strains, particularly those associated with gastrointestinal diseases. It focuses on the detection and characterization of pathogenic organisms, facilitating the understanding of their characteristics, serotypes, and potential resistance mechanisms. The classification supports laboratory practices aimed at ensuring accurate diagnosis and effective treatment strategies, contributing to public health surveillance and epidemiological studies. It stands distinct from other identification and susceptibility testing methodologies by concentrating specifically on the serological profiling of targeted bacteria, enhancing the capability to monitor and respond to infectious disease outbreaks.

this classification encompasses systems designed for the evaluation of microbial susceptibility and identification through a dilution methodology. Such systems are integral for determining the effectiveness of various antimicrobial agents against specific pathogens. The method typically involves the preparation of a series of dilutions of antimicrobial substances, which are then used to assess the growth inhibition of microorganisms. This approach aids in identifying resistance patterns and susceptibility profiles, providing critical information for treatment decisions in clinical settings. The classification highlights its unique position within a broader category that includes diverse testing methods for bacterial identification and susceptibility, differentiating it from other automated and manual testing systems that focus on specific bacterial groups or methodologies.

this classification encompasses specialized items designed for microbiological testing and analysis, particularly focusing on the identification and susceptibility assessment of various microorganisms. These products are characterized by their unique formulation, which enables effective interaction with biological samples to yield precise results. They serve as crucial tools within laboratory settings, facilitating the detection of microbial presence and the evaluation of their resistance to antimicrobial agents. This category distinguishes itself by addressing specific testing methodologies and applications, ensuring that users can select appropriate items tailored for distinct laboratory requirements in the field of bacteriology.

this classification encompasses methodologies utilized for the identification of nucleic acids in various biological samples, emphasizing manual techniques. These procedures are critical for analyzing genetic material, aiding in the detection of specific organisms or pathogens. The focus is on hands-on processes that require skilled personnel to interpret results, distinguishing them from automated systems. This category includes various approaches that leverage biochemical and molecular principles to ensure accurate identification, facilitating diagnostic processes in clinical and research settings. It supports the understanding of microbial characteristics and resistance mechanisms, ultimately contributing to effective treatment strategies and epidemiological studies.

this classification encompasses automated methods specifically designed for the identification of nucleic acids, focusing on the detection of Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA). The technology employed in this category leverages advanced molecular techniques to facilitate rapid and accurate identification of bacterial strains, particularly those exhibiting antibiotic resistance. The processes involved aim to streamline diagnostic workflows in clinical microbiology laboratories, enhancing the efficiency of pathogen detection and ensuring timely intervention in infection control. By utilizing automated systems, this classification also addresses the need for high-throughput testing capabilities, thereby supporting improved patient management and public health outcomes.

preferred_name.label: Nucleic acid identification (automated additional resistance marker)

definition.text: this classification pertains to a method of identifying nucleic acids through automated processes, specifically targeting additional resistance markers associated with microbial organisms. It is utilized in diagnostic settings to enhance the detection and characterization of pathogens, particularly in the context of antimicrobial resistance. The automated approach streamlines the identification process, providing rapid and accurate results that are critical for effective treatment decisions. This classification serves to differentiate these automated identification systems from other manual and automated methods used for identifying various bacterial groups and their susceptibility patterns. It emphasizes the importance of advanced molecular techniques in contemporary bacteriological analysis, particularly in monitoring resistance traits that impact clinical outcomes.

this classification encompasses a range of products and materials specifically designed for the cultivation and analysis of bacteria within the context of in vitro diagnostics. It includes various forms of culture media, both dehydrated and pre-prepared, that facilitate the growth of bacterial specimens. Additionally, it encompasses raw materials necessary for media preparation, as well as additives that enhance growth or select for specific bacterial strains. The category also features transport media designed for the safe handling of samples, ensuring their viability for subsequent testing. Furthermore, it includes specialized media for susceptibility testing and identification, as well as systems for screening urine samples. Various control materials, stains, and buffers are included to ensure accurate diagnostics and reliable results in bacteriological studies.

dehydrated culture media are specialized formulations designed for the cultivation of microorganisms in laboratory settings. These media are prepared by removing moisture from nutrient-rich ingredients, allowing for easy transport and storage. Upon rehydration, they provide the necessary nutrients, growth factors, and pH indicators essential for microbial growth and differentiation. Typically used in microbiological research and diagnostics, these formulations support the isolation and identification of various bacterial species, facilitating studies in bacteriology and related fields. Their specific composition can vary to meet the requirements of different microbial types, ensuring optimal growth conditions.

this classification encompasses substances primarily utilized as foundational components in microbiological applications. These materials are essential for cultivating and sustaining microbial life in laboratory settings, providing the necessary nutrients and environment for growth and experimentation. They are often derived from natural sources and may be processed to enhance their effectiveness in supporting specific bacterial strains. The focus is on items that serve as critical inputs in the production of various culture media, playing a vital role in the study and analysis of microorganisms in both clinical and research contexts.

preferred_name.label: Additive for DCM (growth supplement, selective agent)

definition.text: this classification encompasses substances specifically developed to enhance the growth and selective cultivation of microorganisms in diagnostic applications. These additives are essential for optimizing the conditions necessary for the proliferation and maintenance of specific microbial populations, ensuring accurate and reliable results in laboratory settings. They may serve various functions, including promoting growth, inhibiting unwanted organisms, or enhancing the expression of particular traits in the target microorganisms. The use of these additives is crucial in the preparation of culture media, particularly in the context of in vitro diagnostics, where precise microbial identification and analysis are paramount for effective clinical decision-making.

this category encompasses various media contained within tubes, both in solid and liquid forms, specifically designed for use in bacteriological applications. These media are crucial for the cultivation, isolation, and identification of microorganisms in laboratory settings, particularly in the context of in vitro diagnostics. The offerings within this classification are distinguished by their formulation, intended use, and specificity to different types of bacterial cultures. They serve as the foundation for microbial growth, providing the necessary nutrients and environmental conditions for optimal development, while being differentiated from related products such as dehydrated media, raw materials, and various specialized testing media. This ensures a comprehensive approach to bacteriological analysis and enhances the capabilities of diagnostic laboratories.

a category dedicated to substances or materials specifically designed for the transportation of biological specimens and samples, ensuring their integrity and viability during transit. This includes products engineered to maintain the necessary conditions for the preservation of microorganisms, cells, or other biological entities, preventing degradation or contamination. These transport solutions are crucial for diagnostic processes, enabling the safe and effective transfer of samples to laboratories for analysis. The focus is on ensuring that the transported materials are suitable for subsequent testing, allowing for accurate and reliable results in microbiological studies and evaluations.

this classification encompasses products specifically designed for the transportation of samples intended for nucleic acid testing. These items ensure the preservation and integrity of biological specimens during transit, facilitating accurate and reliable testing outcomes. The focus is on items that maintain the viability of the samples while preventing contamination or degradation. Intended for use in laboratory and clinical settings, these transportation solutions are crucial for maintaining the quality of samples from the point of collection to the analysis stage. Their design accommodates various testing requirements, providing essential support in the field of microbiological diagnostics.

a category encompassing a variety of containers specifically designed for the preservation, transportation, and analysis of biological samples in the context of bacteriological testing and diagnostics. This classification includes items that are utilized for both in vitro and direct applications in clinical settings, emphasizing their role in facilitating microbiological examinations. The offerings within this category are characterized by their compatibility with various testing methodologies and their ability to maintain sample integrity. They serve as essential components in laboratory protocols, supporting the accurate identification and analysis of microbial organisms while ensuring compliance with safety and quality standards.

a category of media utilized in microbiological diagnostics that does not contain chromogenic substances. These media are formulated to support the growth and identification of bacteria through traditional culture methods. They are specifically designed to provide necessary nutrients and optimal conditions for the cultivation of various microbial species without the inclusion of chromogenic indicators, which are often used to reveal specific metabolic activities or characteristics of bacteria. Non-chromogenic media are crucial for accurate microbiological analysis and are widely employed in laboratories for the isolation and enumeration of microorganisms, ensuring that results are based solely on the organisms' natural growth properties.

a type of diagnostic medium specifically designed for the identification of microorganisms through chromogenic reactions. This medium allows for the selective growth of target organisms while inhibiting others, facilitating colorimetric differentiation based on the metabolic activity of the microorganisms present. It is commonly utilized in microbiological laboratories for the cultivation and identification of bacteria, particularly in the context of clinical diagnostics. The formulation is tailored to support specific bacterial growth, enabling the visualization of results through distinct color changes, thereby assisting in the rapid identification of pathogens.

this classification encompasses specialized media utilized for the cultivation and assessment of microorganisms, specifically tailored for susceptibility testing in laboratory settings. These media provide an optimal environment for bacterial growth and are designed to facilitate the evaluation of microbial resistance to various antimicrobial agents. The format typically includes plates that support the application of test organisms, allowing for precise observation of growth patterns and inhibition zones. This category is distinct from other forms of culture media and is characterized by its specific use in diagnosing susceptibility to antibiotics, aiding in the determination of effective treatment options in clinical microbiology.

a medium designed to facilitate the identification and differentiation of specific microorganisms through chromogenic reactions. This type of media is characterized by its ability to produce distinct color changes in response to the metabolic activities of target bacteria, allowing for easier visual recognition of colonies. It is typically utilized in laboratory settings for diagnostic purposes, particularly in the field of bacteriology, and is ideal for use in clinical diagnostics and microbiological research. This medium plays a crucial role in enhancing the efficiency and accuracy of microbial identification processes, distinguishing it from other types of culture media that do not exhibit chromogenic properties.

an automated urine screening system is a sophisticated diagnostic tool designed to analyze urine samples for various parameters, including the presence of pathogens and other biomarkers. This system utilizes advanced technology to perform analyses with minimal human intervention, enhancing efficiency and accuracy in clinical settings. It typically integrates features such as sample processing, result interpretation, and data management, allowing for streamlined workflows and timely reporting of results. This classification encompasses products that facilitate the automation of urine testing, differentiating them from manual testing methods and other media used in microbiological analysis, thus meeting specific laboratory needs in the field of bacteriology and in vitro diagnostics.

a diagnostic tool designed for the qualitative analysis of urine samples, utilizing a strip format for the detection of various parameters indicative of health conditions. This item enables healthcare professionals to perform tests manually, providing results through a visual readout. It serves as an essential component in the field of microbiology and infectious disease diagnostics, particularly for identifying bacterial infections and other urinary tract issues. The product is characterized by its ease of use, rapid results, and suitability for point-of-care testing, making it a valuable resource in clinical settings for preliminary screening.

a diagnostic tool designed for the qualitative assessment of urine samples, utilizing a dipstick method for the detection of various parameters indicative of patient health. This product is employed in clinical settings to screen for potential infections, metabolic disorders, and other health conditions through the analysis of specific chemical reactions on the strip. The manual application allows healthcare professionals to interpret results visually, providing immediate insights into the biochemical composition of the urine. This tool serves as a vital component in laboratory diagnostics, aiding in the initial evaluation and monitoring of patient conditions, and is particularly beneficial for rapid assessment in point-of-care environments.

this classification encompasses various types of substances specifically designed for the identification, culture, and control of bacteria within in vitro diagnostics. These materials are utilized in laboratory settings to facilitate the growth and examination of bacterial cultures, allowing for the assessment of microbial presence and characteristics. The substances in this category are distinguished by their specific function in bacteriological procedures, particularly in the context of diagnostic testing. They play a critical role in the accurate detection and analysis of microbial species, contributing essential information for clinical decision-making and public health monitoring. The focus is on products that enhance the understanding of bacterial behavior and resistance patterns in laboratory environments, ensuring reliable results in diagnostic applications.

a substance or formulation specifically designed to provide the necessary environment or nutrients for the growth and maintenance of microorganisms in laboratory settings, particularly for diagnostic purposes. This category encompasses solutions or mixtures used to support the proliferation of bacterial cultures, allowing for the assessment of microbial characteristics and behaviors. These items are integral to in vitro diagnostics, facilitating the evaluation of various microorganisms under controlled conditions. The buffers in this classification are distinct from other media and substances used in microbiological applications, focusing on their role in stabilizing and maintaining the pH and osmotic balance necessary for optimal microbial growth and analysis.

a gas generating kit is a specialized assembly designed to produce a controlled atmosphere, typically utilized in microbiological applications. This kit facilitates the growth of anaerobic bacteria by creating an environment devoid of oxygen, essential for the cultivation of specific microorganisms. It often includes components such as gas-generating sachets, which release gases like hydrogen and carbon dioxide, along with various materials required for maintaining optimal growth conditions. Such kits are crucial in laboratories and clinical settings, where accurate culturing of bacteria is necessary for diagnostics and research purposes. They enable effective testing and analysis by providing the necessary conditions for the proliferation of anaerobic organisms, thereby supporting the overall goals of bacteriological studies.

a container specifically designed for the collection and cultivation of blood samples to detect the presence of microorganisms. This vessel is intended for use in laboratory settings to facilitate the growth of bacteria and other pathogens from clinical specimens, allowing for subsequent identification and susceptibility testing. The design of this container ensures optimal conditions for microbial growth, including appropriate nutrient content and environmental factors, while also providing a secure and sterile environment to prevent contamination. This type of product is critical in the diagnosis of infections and plays a vital role in the field of microbiology and clinical diagnostics.

a container designed specifically for the automated cultivation of microorganisms from blood samples, facilitating the detection of bacterial or fungal infections. This item is integral to the process of blood culture testing in clinical diagnostics, allowing for the monitoring of microbial growth in a controlled environment. The automated functionality enhances efficiency and accuracy in identifying pathogens, thereby supporting timely medical intervention. This type of container is distinct in its design and application, differentiating it from various other media types and methodologies used in microbiological testing. Its purpose is to streamline the workflow of laboratory procedures associated with blood sample analysis, contributing to improved patient outcomes.

this classification encompasses diagnostic tools and methods focused on the identification of bacterial pathogens and the assessment of their susceptibility to antimicrobial agents. It includes both automated and manual techniques for the detection and characterization of various bacteria, including those that are gram-negative, gram-positive, and anaerobic. The methods range from traditional culture techniques to advanced molecular diagnostics. The classification also covers systems that combine identification and susceptibility testing, providing comprehensive solutions for clinical microbiology laboratories. These tools are essential for guiding effective treatment options and managing infectious diseases, ensuring accurate diagnosis and appropriate therapeutic interventions.

this classification encompasses automated methods for the identification of specific types of bacteria characterized by the absence of a thick peptidoglycan layer in their cell walls. These organisms are typically distinguished by their unique biochemical properties and pathogenicity profiles. The classification focuses on systems designed to accurately identify these bacteria through automated processes, facilitating rapid and reliable diagnosis in clinical microbiology settings. Additionally, it emphasizes the importance of identifying antibiotic resistance patterns associated with these organisms to inform effective treatment strategies. This category is distinct from other classifications that involve different bacterial types or identification methodologies, underscoring its specialized focus on automated identification techniques for this specific group of microorganisms.

this category encompasses automated systems specifically designed for the identification of Gram-positive bacteria. These systems utilize advanced methodologies to rapidly detect and characterize Gram-positive organisms, facilitating effective diagnosis and treatment decisions. The focus is on the automated processes that streamline the identification procedure, enhancing efficiency and accuracy in clinical microbiology. This classification is distinct from those aimed at Gram-negative bacteria and other types of organisms, as well as various susceptibility testing methods. The primary purpose is to provide a comprehensive framework for the automated identification of Gram-positive species in laboratory settings, ensuring reliable results that support healthcare outcomes.

this classification encompasses a variety of organisms that thrive in environments devoid of oxygen and those that have specific growth requirements. It pertains to the identification and testing of susceptibility of these microorganisms, which may not be easily cultured or identified using standard methods. The organisms classified here are of particular interest in clinical microbiology, where accurate identification is crucial for effective treatment. This category supports a range of testing methodologies, reflecting advancements in microbiological practices aimed at improving diagnostic accuracy and therapeutic outcomes. It serves as a vital resource for laboratories focusing on the detection and characterization of challenging pathogens that require specialized handling and testing techniques.

automated testing methods designed specifically for evaluating the susceptibility of Gram-negative bacteria to various antimicrobial agents. This classification encompasses systems and techniques that facilitate the rapid and accurate determination of bacterial resistance patterns, aiding in the selection of effective treatment options. Such methods often integrate advanced technologies that streamline the testing process, enhance precision, and reduce turnaround times, ensuring timely patient management. The focus is on Gram-negative organisms, which are known for their diverse resistance mechanisms and clinical relevance in infections. These testing solutions are critical in clinical microbiology laboratories, contributing to improved patient outcomes through targeted antibiotic therapy.

a method of testing used to determine the susceptibility of bacteria that retain the Gram stain, indicating a specific cell wall structure. This process is typically automated and is utilized in microbiological laboratories to facilitate the identification of effective antibiotics against these organisms. The testing involves exposing bacterial isolates to various antimicrobial agents to assess their growth response, thereby guiding clinical decisions for effective treatment. This approach is essential for managing infections caused by Gram-positive bacteria, ensuring that healthcare providers can select appropriate therapeutic options based on resistance patterns. The methodology is characterized by its standardization, efficiency, and ability to deliver timely results in diagnostic settings.

preferred_name.label: Combined susceptibility and identification system (gram negatives automated)

definition.text: a system designed to provide simultaneous determination of susceptibility and identification of specific microorganisms within the Gram-negative category. This system employs automated methodologies to enhance precision and efficiency in microbiological diagnostics. It integrates advanced techniques for accurately identifying pathogens while concurrently assessing their resistance profiles against various antimicrobial agents. This classification encompasses products and services that facilitate rapid and reliable results in clinical and laboratory settings, supporting effective treatment decisions and infection control measures. The system is distinct from other identification and susceptibility testing systems that focus solely on either Gram-positive or other bacterial types, highlighting its unique application in the realm of Gram-negative organisms.

preferred_name.label: Combined susceptibility and identification system (gram positives automated)

definition.text: a system designed to simultaneously assess the susceptibility and identify specific strains of gram-positive bacteria through automated processes. This technology integrates advanced methodologies to provide accurate results in a streamlined manner, enhancing efficiency in microbiological testing. It distinguishes itself from other systems by focusing exclusively on gram-positive organisms and employs sophisticated algorithms and reagents to deliver rapid and reliable outcomes. The system is essential for clinical laboratories aiming to optimize their diagnostic capabilities, specifically in the context of identifying various gram-positive pathogens and determining their resistance patterns to facilitate effective treatment plans.

preferred_name.label: Anaerobes and fastidious automated suscept. testing

definition.text: this classification encompasses tools and systems specifically designed for the identification and susceptibility testing of anaerobic and fastidious microorganisms. It includes automated methods that facilitate the detection of resistance patterns and sensitivities of these organisms against various antimicrobial agents. The focus is on enhancing the accuracy and efficiency of testing processes, which are critical for effective clinical decision-making and treatment planning. This classification is distinct from other methodologies that apply to broader categories of bacteria, allowing for a specialized approach to the unique challenges posed by anaerobes and other fastidious pathogens.

this classification encompasses methods and techniques used for the identification of Gram-negative bacteria through manual processes. It is designed for laboratories and healthcare facilities to facilitate accurate and reliable detection of these microorganisms. This category includes various manual testing protocols that focus on differentiating Gram-negative species and determining their susceptibility to antibiotics. The emphasis is on traditional laboratory methods that require manual intervention, ensuring thorough and precise identification. This classification serves as a crucial resource for microbiologists and clinical laboratories in their efforts to diagnose infections caused by Gram-negative bacteria, which are often associated with significant clinical challenges due to their varied resistance mechanisms.

this classification encompasses methods and techniques specifically used to identify Gram-positive microorganisms through manual procedures. It includes various laboratory practices aimed at determining the presence of specific Gram-positive bacteria, which are characterized by their unique cell wall structure that retains a purple stain during the Gram staining process. The focus is on traditional identification methods that may involve visual inspection, biochemical testing, or other manual techniques to ascertain the type and characteristics of these organisms. This category is distinct from those that pertain to automated identification processes or different types of organisms, emphasizing the hands-on approach in microbiological diagnostics.

this classification encompasses a category of organisms characterized by their lack of a cell wall and their unique metabolic pathways, which often require specialized techniques for identification and susceptibility testing. These organisms are typically associated with various clinical conditions and can be challenging to detect using standard microbiological methods. The classification includes methodologies for both identifying these organisms and determining their susceptibility to specific antimicrobial agents, facilitating effective treatment options. This category is distinct in its focus on these wall-less microorganisms, which necessitates tailored approaches in laboratory settings to ensure accurate diagnosis and appropriate therapeutic strategies.

a specialized device designed for use in clinical laboratories, this item functions as an electrode that selectively measures the concentration of magnesium ions in biological samples. It operates on principles of electrochemistry, providing accurate and reliable readings crucial for various diagnostic applications. This electrode is essential for assessing magnesium levels, which play a vital role in numerous physiological processes. It is specifically engineered to ensure optimal performance and compatibility with laboratory equipment, allowing for seamless integration into automated analytical systems. The device is calibrated to provide precise measurements, aiding healthcare professionals in monitoring and diagnosing conditions related to magnesium imbalances.

this classification refers to a specialized instrument designed for clinical laboratory environments, utilized to measure the concentration of potassium ions in biological samples. It plays a crucial role in various diagnostic procedures, enabling healthcare professionals to monitor electrolyte levels and assess patient health. The device operates based on electrochemical principles and is essential for evaluating conditions related to kidney function, hydration status, and electrolyte imbalances. The potassium electrode is distinct from other similar instruments that measure different ions or substances, each tailored for specific clinical applications and diagnostic needs.

a device designed for clinical laboratory use that measures the concentration of sodium ions in a liquid sample, typically blood or serum. This type of electrode functions through electrochemical principles, providing accurate and reliable readings essential for diagnosing and monitoring various medical conditions related to electrolyte balance. It is distinct from other types of ion-selective electrodes, each tailored for specific ions, thereby allowing for targeted analysis in clinical diagnostics. The sodium electrode plays a critical role in assessing patient health, facilitating timely medical decisions based on electrolyte levels.

a device designed to measure the concentration of carbon dioxide in biological fluids, utilizing a bicarbonate-based electrode. This instrument operates on principles of electrochemistry, providing precise and reliable readings essential for clinical laboratory applications. It is specifically tailored for assessing respiratory function and metabolic processes, distinguishing itself from other electrodes that measure different ions or substances. The design facilitates compatibility with various analytical systems, ensuring accurate diagnostics in healthcare settings. Its application is critical for monitoring patients' acid-base balance and overall metabolic status, making it a vital tool in clinical laboratories.

a device designed for the quantitative measurement of creatinine levels in biological samples, primarily used in clinical laboratory settings. This instrument functions by utilizing electrochemical principles to detect creatinine concentration, aiding in the assessment of kidney function and overall metabolic health. It is specifically calibrated for high accuracy and sensitivity in the presence of various biological matrices. This type of electrode plays a critical role in diagnostic procedures, contributing to the monitoring of renal conditions and assisting healthcare professionals in making informed clinical decisions. Its unique operational characteristics set it apart from other types of electrodes used for measuring different analytes in similar environments.

this classification identifies a specific type of analytical device used in clinical laboratories for the quantitative measurement of glucose levels in biological samples. It operates based on electrochemical principles, utilizing an electrode to detect glucose concentration, which is crucial for monitoring metabolic conditions, particularly diabetes management. This device plays a vital role in ensuring accurate and timely diagnoses, supporting healthcare professionals in making informed decisions regarding patient care. The glucose electrode is distinguished by its sensitivity, specificity, and response time, setting it apart from other types of electrodes used for different analytes in the clinical laboratory environment.

this classification encompasses devices specifically designed to measure glycated haemoglobin levels in clinical laboratory settings. These electrodes are integral in diagnosing and monitoring conditions related to glucose metabolism, such as diabetes. The technology facilitates the accurate assessment of long-term glucose control by quantifying the percentage of glycated haemoglobin in a blood sample. Such measurements are essential for healthcare providers to evaluate a patient's average blood sugar levels over an extended period, enabling informed therapeutic decisions. This classification is distinct from other types of electrodes that measure various electrolytes or metabolites, reflecting its specialized function in clinical diagnostics.

a device designed for the measurement of lactate levels in biological samples, typically utilized in clinical laboratory settings. This tool operates on the principle of electrochemical detection, converting biochemical reactions into electrical signals that indicate the concentration of lactate. It is essential for assessing metabolic conditions, monitoring exercise performance, and evaluating patients in critical care environments. The lactate electrode is specifically tailored to provide accurate and rapid results, which aids in diagnosing and managing conditions related to lactic acidosis and other metabolic disorders. It is distinct from other electrodes that measure different ions or metabolites, ensuring its unique application in clinical diagnostics.

a urea electrode designed for clinical laboratory applications is a specialized analytical device used to measure the concentration of urea in biological samples. This electrode operates based on electrochemical principles, enabling precise detection and quantification of urea levels, which are critical for assessing kidney function and metabolic states. It is distinct from other types of electrodes used in clinical settings, each tailored to measure different analytes, ensuring accurate diagnostics and monitoring of patient health. The urea electrode's design and functionality are optimized for efficiency, reliability, and ease of use in laboratory environments, contributing to effective patient care and clinical decision-making.

a device designed for the quantitative measurement of bilirubin levels in biological samples, typically utilized in clinical laboratory settings. This instrument functions through electrochemical principles to provide accurate and reliable testing outcomes, aiding in the diagnosis and monitoring of various medical conditions related to liver function and hemolysis. The bilirubin electrode is specifically engineered to respond selectively to bilirubin, distinguishing it from other electrodes that measure different analytes. It is an essential tool in clinical diagnostics, contributing to patient care by facilitating timely and precise laboratory analyses.

a reference electrode designed for use in clinical laboratory settings is a specialized electrode that serves as a stable reference point for measuring the potential of other electrodes during electrochemical analysis. It is crucial for ensuring accurate and reliable readings in various diagnostic tests, providing a consistent baseline against which the voltages of other electrodes can be measured. This type of electrode is essential for applications that involve potentiometric measurements, where the precise determination of ion concentrations is necessary for clinical assessments. The reference electrode typically utilizes a stable electrochemical system that maintains a constant potential, allowing for precise comparisons in the measurement of various analytes in biological samples.

a solution or mixture designed to maintain or adjust the ionic environment necessary for the proper functioning of electrodes used in clinical laboratory settings. This type of formulation is specifically tailored to enhance the performance and reliability of electrochemical measurements, ensuring accurate readings by stabilizing the pH and ionic strength of the measurement medium. It serves as a crucial component in various analytical processes, facilitating the interaction between the electrode and the sample being analyzed. These formulations may comprise various salts, acids, or other buffering agents, designed to optimize the operational conditions for a range of electrode types used in clinical diagnostics.

a substance specifically designed to enhance the performance and stability of electrodes used in clinical laboratory settings. This substance serves as a medium that facilitates the proper functioning of electrodes by providing an optimal environment for electrochemical reactions. It may comprise various chemical components that ensure the electrode maintains its sensitivity and accuracy when measuring specific analytes in biological samples. The formulation is engineered to mitigate interference from other substances present in the sample, thereby ensuring reliable and reproducible results in clinical diagnostics. This category is distinct from others that focus on specific types of electrodes, highlighting its unique role in supporting the overall functionality of electrochemical measurement devices in medical applications.

a solution or mixture utilized to maintain the electrochemical environment necessary for the proper functioning of electrodes in analytical applications. This formulation typically includes electrolytes that facilitate the conduction of electrical currents, enhancing the accuracy and reliability of measurements taken in clinical laboratory settings. These substances are essential for calibrating and stabilizing various types of electrodes, ensuring optimal performance during testing and analysis. Their composition is designed to support a range of laboratory procedures, contributing to the overall efficacy of diagnostic tools and methodologies used in clinical environments.
