this classification encompasses diagnostic tests designed for the rapid detection of infectious agents through immunological methods. These tests are typically characterized by their ability to deliver quick results, facilitating timely clinical decision-making. The focus is on identifying specific antigens or antibodies related to various infectious diseases, enabling healthcare professionals to diagnose conditions efficiently. This category specifically excludes other testing areas such as bacteriology, hepatitis virus, retroviruses, virology, parasitology, and mycology, ensuring a clear distinction in the types of immunological tests being classified. The items classified here are essential tools in infectious disease management, particularly in acute settings where rapid diagnosis is critical for effective patient care.

a rapid diagnostic test designed to detect the presence of Chlamydia antigens in biological samples, facilitating the identification of Chlamydia infections. This test operates on the principle of immunoassay, providing results in a short timeframe, which is crucial for timely diagnosis and treatment. The test is typically characterized by its ease of use, requiring minimal technical expertise, and is suitable for point-of-care settings. It plays a vital role in public health by enabling rapid screening and monitoring of Chlamydia, contributing to effective disease management and control strategies. The specificity and sensitivity of the test are essential for accurate results, ensuring reliable identification of this common sexually transmitted infection.

a diagnostic procedure designed for the rapid detection of a specific bacterium associated with gastrointestinal infections. This test provides a quick assessment of the presence of the bacterium in biological samples, facilitating timely diagnosis and treatment options. The method employed is typically immunological in nature, allowing for the identification of antibodies or antigens related to the bacterium. This rapid testing approach is essential in clinical settings where swift results are crucial for patient management. It is particularly useful in outpatient environments and for initial screening purposes to guide further diagnostic investigations or therapeutic interventions.

this classification refers to a diagnostic test designed for the rapid identification of a specific bacterial pathogen known to cause infections in humans. The test is characterized by its ability to deliver quick results, facilitating timely medical decisions. It operates on principles of immunological detection, utilizing specific antibodies or antigens related to the targeted organism. This rapid testing method is essential in clinical settings for the swift diagnosis of infections, allowing healthcare professionals to initiate appropriate treatment strategies without significant delays. It is distinct from other similar diagnostic tests that target different infectious agents, emphasizing its unique role in infectious disease management.

a diagnostic tool designed for the rapid detection of a specific bacterial pathogen, enabling clinicians to identify the presence of this microorganism in a biological sample. This test utilizes immunological methods to provide results within a short timeframe, facilitating timely diagnosis and treatment decisions. It is essential in the context of infectious diseases, allowing for the differentiation of this pathogen from other similar infections. The product is intended for use in clinical laboratories and point-of-care settings, ensuring quick and efficient patient management. The rapid test contributes to improved healthcare outcomes by allowing for immediate clinical action based on the test results.

this classification encompasses diagnostic tests that provide rapid results for the detection of specific infectious agents. These tests are designed to identify the presence of particular antigens or antibodies associated with various pathogens, facilitating quick decision-making in clinical settings. The focus is on tests that deliver results in a short timeframe, allowing for timely diagnosis and treatment of infections. Each item within this category is distinct in terms of the specific infectious agent it targets, enabling healthcare professionals to accurately assess and manage patient conditions related to infectious diseases.

preferred_name.label: Clostridium difficile (inclusive toxin A and B, rapid test)

definition.text: this classification encompasses a diagnostic tool used for the detection of Clostridium difficile, including its associated toxins A and B, through a rapid testing method. It serves to identify the presence of this specific pathogen in clinical samples, facilitating timely diagnosis and treatment. This category is distinct from other rapid testing procedures for various infectious agents, each targeting different pathogens or diseases, thereby highlighting its unique application in infectious immunology. The rapid test is designed to provide quick results, aiding healthcare professionals in making informed decisions regarding patient management and infection control.

a diagnostic tool designed for the rapid detection of the pathogen responsible for meningitis, utilizing immunological methods to identify specific antigens or antibodies associated with the infectious agent. This test is intended for swift clinical decision-making in situations where timely diagnosis is critical. It aims to provide healthcare professionals with immediate results to facilitate appropriate treatment and management of patients suspected of having meningitis. The methodology employed in this test ensures high sensitivity and specificity, contributing to accurate diagnosis while minimizing the time required for laboratory analysis.

a diagnostic tool designed to detect the presence of specific antigens associated with the Legionella bacteria in a rapid manner. This method allows for quick identification of potential infections caused by Legionella species, enabling timely clinical decision-making. The test is typically performed on samples such as respiratory secretions, and it is essential in the context of infectious disease management. The rapid nature of this assessment provides results in a short time frame, facilitating prompt treatment and intervention for affected individuals. This classification encompasses various rapid testing methods focusing on infectious immunology, highlighting the importance of swift and accurate detection in managing infectious diseases.

a diagnostic tool designed for the rapid detection of Hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg) in biological samples. This test is utilized in clinical settings to provide immediate results, facilitating the identification of active Hepatitis B infections. The rapid test format allows healthcare professionals to make timely decisions regarding patient management and treatment. It is characterized by its ease of use, quick turnaround time, and the ability to deliver results without the need for extensive laboratory infrastructure. The technology employed may vary but typically involves immunological methods that yield qualitative results, indicating the presence or absence of the antigen. This classification uniquely addresses the specific needs and applications associated with Hepatitis B diagnosis within the broader category of infectious immunology testing.

a diagnostic tool designed for the rapid detection of antibodies associated with a specific virus, typically used in clinical settings to provide quick results for screening or confirming infections. This type of assay utilizes immunological methods to identify the presence of antibodies in a patient's sample, facilitating timely diagnosis and management of infectious diseases. The rapid test format ensures results are obtained in a short timeframe, supporting immediate clinical decision-making. This category is distinguished from other similar tests based on the specific target antibodies being analyzed, contributing to different diagnostic pathways in infectious immunology.

a diagnostic tool designed for the rapid detection of HIV 1 antibodies, facilitating timely and efficient screening for this specific viral infection. This test employs immunological techniques to determine the presence of antibodies in a patient's sample, providing results in a short timeframe. The method is crucial for early diagnosis, enabling healthcare professionals to initiate appropriate treatment and care. It is important in public health initiatives aimed at controlling the spread of HIV, particularly in high-risk populations. This category is distinct from other rapid tests targeting various infectious agents, each tailored to identify specific pathogens or antibodies relevant to their respective diseases.

a rapid diagnostic test designed to detect the presence of antibodies to the Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) types 1 and 2 in human specimens. This test is characterized by its quick turnaround time, enabling healthcare providers to obtain results within a short period, facilitating timely clinical decision-making. It is utilized in various settings, including hospitals, clinics, and community health programs, to screen individuals for HIV infection. The test contributes to public health efforts aimed at early detection and management of HIV, thereby playing a critical role in preventing the transmission of the virus and improving the health outcomes of affected individuals.

a diagnostic tool designed for the rapid detection of specific infectious agents or biomarkers related to immunological responses. This type of test is characterized by its ability to provide quick results, facilitating timely clinical decision-making. It is utilized in various healthcare settings to identify the presence of pathogens or antibodies, aiding in the diagnosis of infectious diseases. The tests are typically designed for ease of use, often requiring minimal preparation and providing results in a short timeframe. They play a critical role in the management of infectious diseases by enabling healthcare professionals to initiate appropriate treatment swiftly, thereby improving patient outcomes and controlling the spread of infections.

a diagnostic tool designed for the rapid detection of specific infectious diseases through immunological methods. This type of test allows for quick identification of pathogens or their components in various sample types, enabling timely clinical decision-making. The test is characterized by its ease of use, requiring minimal equipment or specialized training for administration. Results are typically available within a short timeframe, facilitating prompt diagnosis and treatment. It is employed in various healthcare settings, including hospitals and clinics, to assist in the management of infectious diseases. This particular category focuses on assays that target a specific infectious agent, differentiating it from other rapid tests aimed at detecting different pathogens or conditions.

a specialized formulation designed for the cultivation and isolation of mycobacteria in laboratory settings, typically provided in tube or bottle formats. This media is specifically intended for use in microbiological assays, enabling the growth of mycobacterial species by providing essential nutrients, growth factors, and specific environmental conditions. It supports the identification and diagnosis of mycobacterial infections, serving as a critical tool in clinical and research laboratories. The media may include selective agents to inhibit the growth of non-target organisms, ensuring optimal conditions for the proliferation of mycobacteria. This classification distinguishes it from other media types utilized in bacteriological cultures, emphasizing its unique application and formulation tailored for mycobacterial diagnostics.

a category encompassing specialized liquid media designed for the cultivation and detection of mycobacteria in laboratory settings. This type of media is typically packaged in bottles suitable for automated systems, facilitating efficient processing and analysis of samples. It serves as a vital tool in microbiological diagnostics, particularly in identifying and studying mycobacterial species, which are of significant interest in the context of infectious diseases. The classification distinctly separates it from other media types utilized in bacteriology, focusing on its unique formulation and application in automated laboratory environments.

this classification encompasses devices and materials specifically designed for clinical laboratory applications that measure or analyze biochemical substances through electrochemical methods. These items are integral to various diagnostic processes, providing critical information about the concentration of specific ions, metabolites, and other analytes in biological samples. The category includes electrodes tailored for measuring various electrolytes and metabolites, along with associated buffers and solutions that facilitate accurate testing. These components play a vital role in clinical chemistry, ensuring precise and reliable results essential for patient diagnosis and monitoring. This grouping is distinct from other related classifications that involve different types of reagents or methodologies used in clinical settings.

an ammonia electrode used in clinical laboratories is a specialized sensor designed to measure the concentration of ammonia in biological samples. This device operates on principles of electrochemistry, providing precise and rapid detection of ammonia levels, which are critical for diagnosing various medical conditions. The ammonia electrode is essential in monitoring metabolic processes and assessing liver function, as elevated ammonia levels can indicate dysfunction. This type of electrode is calibrated for accuracy and sensitivity, ensuring reliable results in laboratory settings. Its application is vital for healthcare professionals who require accurate biochemical data to inform treatment decisions and patient care.

a device designed to measure the concentration of calcium ions in biological samples, primarily used in clinical laboratory settings. This instrument operates based on electrochemical principles, providing precise and reliable readings essential for diagnosing and monitoring various medical conditions related to calcium metabolism. The device typically features a sensing element that responds to the presence of calcium ions, translating their activity into measurable electrical signals. Its applications are critical in areas such as endocrinology and nephrology, where calcium levels play a significant role in patient health assessment and treatment planning. The functionality of this device is distinct from other ion-selective electrodes, each targeting different ions or compounds relevant to clinical diagnostics.

a device designed for the measurement of chloride ion concentration in biological samples, specifically utilized in clinical laboratory settings. This electrode operates based on the electrochemical response generated by chloride ions, providing precise and reliable analytical data. It is essential for various diagnostic applications, including electrolyte balance assessments and monitoring of metabolic conditions. The functionality of this electrode is tailored to ensure compatibility with standard laboratory equipment, making it a vital tool for healthcare professionals. Its design prioritizes accuracy, stability, and ease of use, contributing to effective patient care through enhanced diagnostic capabilities.

a device designed for the measurement of voltage or potential differences associated with lithium ions in a clinical laboratory setting. This instrument is utilized in various diagnostic procedures to assess lithium concentration in biological samples, aiding in monitoring therapeutic levels and ensuring patient safety. It plays a critical role in clinical evaluations and research, contributing to the accurate analysis of lithium's pharmacokinetics and its impact on health conditions. The device operates based on electrochemical principles, providing reliable and precise measurements essential for informed clinical decision-making.

this category encompasses specific types of haemoglobin fractions that are crucial for diagnostic purposes in the field of haematology. The focus is on distinct subtypes of haemoglobin, each with unique physiological and clinical significance. These subtypes play an essential role in various diagnostic tests aimed at identifying or monitoring specific conditions related to blood disorders. The classification is designed to facilitate the identification and utilization of reagents that detect, quantify, or analyze these haemoglobin variants, thereby supporting healthcare professionals in delivering accurate diagnoses and effective patient management. It is important to note that this classification excludes certain common reagents used for broader haematological assessments or controls, focusing instead on the specialized needs associated with these particular haemoglobin subtypes.

this classification encompasses a category of diagnostic substances specifically designed for the examination and analysis of biological tissue samples and cellular structures. These substances facilitate the identification and differentiation of various cellular components, enhancing the visualization of tissue morphology and cellular characteristics under microscopic evaluation. The category is distinct from other reagents used in hematological assessments, which may involve different methodologies, target different biological markers, or serve specific procedural purposes in blood analysis and related diagnostics. Such substances play a crucial role in supporting medical professionals in diagnosing diseases, conducting research, and advancing clinical knowledge in the field of pathology and cytology.

a staining solution used primarily in the examination of blood and other biological specimens, facilitating the visualization of cellular structures under a microscope. This reagent is integral to the identification and differentiation of various cell types, enhancing the diagnostic capabilities of haematological assessments. It is specifically formulated to produce distinct colorimetric reactions, allowing for the assessment of cellular morphology and the detection of abnormalities. The application of this reagent is critical in clinical and research settings, contributing to the analysis of blood samples and aiding in the diagnosis of hematological disorders.

preferred_name.label: Cellular enzyme determination reagent (G-6-PDH, pyruvate kinase)

definition.text: a substance used in laboratory testing to identify and quantify specific enzyme activities related to cellular metabolism. This reagent plays a crucial role in diagnostic procedures, particularly in the analysis of blood samples, to assess enzyme functions that can indicate various health conditions. Its application is essential in clinical settings where accurate hematological evaluations are required. This reagent is distinct from other hematology-related substances, focusing specifically on enzymatic reactions rather than general blood component analysis or other diagnostic functions.

a test used to measure the rate at which red blood cells settle at the bottom of a test tube containing blood. This measurement is utilized to evaluate the presence of inflammation or other medical conditions. The procedure involves the collection of a blood sample, which is then subjected to a standardized process to determine the sedimentation rate. An elevated rate may indicate various health issues, while a normal rate can suggest the absence of significant inflammatory processes. This test is commonly employed in clinical laboratories as part of a comprehensive assessment of a patient's health status.

this classification encompasses a range of products specifically designed for monitoring and managing normal blood pressure levels. These products are utilized in both clinical and home settings to ensure accurate readings and assessments of blood pressure. They are crucial for preventive healthcare measures, allowing for regular monitoring to maintain cardiovascular health. In this context, the products serve as essential tools for healthcare professionals and patients alike, facilitating ongoing health management and early detection of potential issues. This classification distinctly excludes items related to abnormal blood pressure control, multi-level monitoring devices, and various hematology reagents associated with other specific blood parameters or conditions.

this classification pertains to the assessment of blood pressure parameters that deviate from established normal ranges. It encompasses products or services designed specifically for monitoring, evaluating, or managing blood pressure levels that are categorized as abnormal. The offerings within this classification support healthcare professionals in diagnosing hypertension or other related cardiovascular conditions. These tools may include diagnostic devices, reagents, and other aids that facilitate the accurate measurement and analysis of blood pressure readings. The focus is on ensuring that such measurements provide reliable data for effective patient management and treatment planning in clinical settings.

a category for products or services designed specifically for the assessment and management of blood pressure levels, offering various methodologies to ensure accurate monitoring and control. This classification encompasses tools and reagents utilized in clinical settings, focusing on the precise measurement and evaluation of blood pressure variations. These items are essential for healthcare professionals in diagnosing and managing conditions related to hypertension or other cardiovascular issues. The offerings include solutions that may be utilized in both routine checks and specialized testing scenarios, ensuring a comprehensive approach to blood pressure management.

a substance or preparation used specifically for the assessment and monitoring of haemoglobin levels in biological samples, enabling healthcare professionals to evaluate and manage conditions related to blood oxygen transport and overall health. This product is designed to provide precise measurements for diagnostic purposes, and is typically utilized in laboratory settings or point-of-care environments. It is distinguished from other reagents that serve different functions in haematological analysis, focusing solely on the control and calibration of haemoglobin detection methods to ensure accuracy in test results.

this classification pertains to a category of reagents specifically designed for the monitoring and assessment of platelet functionality and concentration in blood samples. These reagents are utilized in various diagnostic procedures to evaluate platelet activity, which is crucial for understanding coagulation processes and diagnosing related disorders. The products in this category are distinguished by their specific application in platelet analysis, differentiating them from other hematological reagents that focus on red blood cells, hemoglobin levels, or general blood composition. They play a vital role in clinical laboratories and healthcare settings, facilitating accurate diagnostic outcomes and effective patient management in conditions involving thrombocytopenia or other platelet function abnormalities.

a substance or preparation specifically designed for the assessment and monitoring of reticulocyte levels in blood samples. This type of reagent plays a critical role in evaluating bone marrow function and red blood cell production, providing insights into various hematological conditions. It is distinguished from other reagents used in hematology by its unique focus on reticulocyte measurement, which is essential for diagnosing and managing anemia and evaluating responses to treatment. This reagent supports laboratory professionals in accurately determining reticulocyte counts and ensuring reliable results in clinical diagnostics.

a substance or preparation used to establish a reference point in laboratory assays related to the analysis of blood components. This material is specifically designed to ensure accuracy and reliability in testing procedures, providing a standard against which test results can be compared. It plays a crucial role in calibrating instruments and validating methodologies within hematological diagnostics, thereby facilitating the assessment of various blood parameters and contributing to accurate patient assessments. This category encompasses products that are essential for quality control in hematology laboratories, ensuring compliance with testing protocols and enhancing the precision of diagnostic results.

preferred_name.label: Haemoglobin (Hb, Rapid Haematology, Rapid Test, Point-of-Care)

definition.text: this classification pertains to diagnostic reagents specifically designed for the rapid measurement of haemoglobin levels in blood samples. These reagents facilitate quick and accurate assessment of haemoglobin concentration, enabling immediate clinical decisions at the point of care. Typically used in various healthcare settings, these testing solutions are crucial for monitoring and diagnosing conditions related to blood health, such as anemia or polycythemia. The rapid nature of this testing ensures timely intervention and management of patients, enhancing overall healthcare efficiency and effectiveness. The classification excludes other types of blood reagents or controls that do not focus specifically on the rapid determination of haemoglobin.

preferred_name.label: Erythrocytes (Ery, Rapid Haematology, Rapid Test, Point-of-Care)

definition.text: a substance specifically designed for the qualitative or quantitative assessment of red blood cells in biological samples, typically utilized in point-of-care testing environments. This category encompasses reagents that facilitate rapid analysis and diagnosis related to erythrocyte characteristics, including their count, morphology, and functionality, thereby aiding healthcare professionals in the swift evaluation of patient conditions. The products in this category are intended for immediate use, often in conjunction with portable testing devices, ensuring timely results in various clinical settings. These reagents may also include components that enhance the accuracy of erythrocyte measurements while differentiating from other hematological assessments.

preferred_name.label: Haematocrit (HCT, Rapid Haematology, Rapid Test, Point-of-Care)

definition.text: this classification encompasses diagnostic materials designed specifically for the rapid assessment of hematocrit levels in blood samples. These substances are utilized in point-of-care settings, enabling healthcare professionals to quickly evaluate the volume percentage of red blood cells in whole blood. The focus is on tests that provide immediate results, facilitating timely clinical decisions. The defined materials are distinct from other hematology reagents that serve different purposes, such as those related to cellular analysis, blood pressure monitoring, or other hematological assessments. The intent is to support effective patient management through efficient and accurate diagnostic processes in various healthcare environments.

this classification encompasses a category of biologically derived agents specifically designed for therapeutic or diagnostic purposes, primarily in immunological and hematological contexts. These agents are engineered to target specific proteins or cells, facilitating enhanced detection, analysis, or management of various conditions related to the immune system and blood disorders. The focus is on antibodies that have been produced from a single clone of cells, ensuring uniformity and specificity in their interactions with antigens. Applications may include but are not limited to, cellular identification, disease monitoring, and therapeutic interventions, particularly in oncology and immunology. This category serves as a crucial tool in clinical and research settings, aiding in the understanding and treatment of complex biological systems.

preferred_name.label: Antibody for B and T-cell subtyping

definition.text: a specialized reagent designed for the identification and classification of B and T-cell populations, facilitating the analysis of immune responses and cellular interactions. This product is utilized in various laboratory applications, including research and clinical diagnostics, to provide insights into immune system functionality and disorders. It is characterized by its specificity in binding to unique markers present on the surface of B and T lymphocytes, enabling precise differentiation and enumeration of these cell types. This reagent is essential in applications such as immunophenotyping, where understanding the composition and characteristics of lymphocyte subsets is critical for diagnosing and monitoring diseases related to the immune system.

preferred_name.label: Antibody for HLA class II determinant

definition.text: a specific type of protein that is produced by immune cells, designed to bind to particular molecules known as HLA class II determinants. These proteins play a crucial role in the immune response by identifying and targeting specific antigens presented by cells. This classification includes those antibodies that are generated through hybridoma technology, ensuring high specificity and affinity for their intended target. The primary use of this type of antibody is in research and clinical diagnostics, particularly in the context of immunology and transplantation, where understanding the interaction between immune cells and antigen-presenting cells is essential. It is distinct from other similar products that target different cell types or functionalities in the immune system.

preferred_name.label: Antibody for lymphoma typing (except B- and T-cell typing)

definition.text: a specialized biological reagent designed to bind specifically to unique markers associated with lymphomas, facilitating the identification and classification of these malignancies. This reagent is distinguished from others that target specific cell types or immune responses, focusing solely on lymphoma types not related to B-cell or T-cell lineages. It plays a crucial role in diagnostic procedures, enabling healthcare professionals to ascertain the presence of lymphoma and guide treatment decisions. The application of this reagent is vital for enhancing the accuracy of lymphoma typing, thereby improving patient outcomes through tailored therapeutic approaches.

preferred_name.label: Antibody for recognizing cell surface receptors

definition.text: a specific type of antibody designed for the recognition and binding to cell surface receptors, facilitating the identification and analysis of various cell types in biological research and clinical applications. This type of antibody is characterized by its ability to selectively interact with specific proteins located on the exterior of cells, playing a critical role in immunological studies, cellular signaling investigations, and diagnostic processes. The usage of this antibody is paramount in assays aimed at understanding cellular interactions, disease mechanisms, and therapeutic targets, making it an essential tool in both research laboratories and clinical settings.

preferred_name.label: Antibody for subtyping of leukemia (except B- and T-cell typing)

definition.text: a specialized biological reagent designed for the identification and classification of specific leukemia subtypes, excluding those associated with B- and T-cell lineages. This reagent operates by binding to unique antigens present on the surface of leukemia cells, facilitating their differentiation from other cell types. It is utilized in diagnostic and research settings to enhance understanding of leukemia pathophysiology and to guide therapeutic decisions. The functionality of this reagent is distinct from others that target different cell types or functions, ensuring precise applications in the field of hematology and oncology.

this category encompasses specialized biological agents designed to bind to specific proteins on the surface of lymphocytes, facilitating the identification and characterization of different subpopulations within this type of white blood cell. These agents are utilized primarily in immunological research and clinical diagnostics to provide insights into immune responses, disease states, and cellular functions. The focus is on distinguishing between various lymphocyte subtypes, which is crucial for understanding various immunological conditions and for guiding therapeutic decisions. Such products may be employed in laboratory techniques, including flow cytometry and immunohistochemistry, to enhance the accuracy of lymphocyte profiling and to support the development of targeted therapies.

this classification pertains to specialized biochemical agents that are engineered to bind specifically to unique enzymes. These agents are utilized extensively in research and clinical settings to facilitate the detection, quantification, and analysis of enzyme activity. They play a crucial role in various applications, including diagnostic assays, therapeutic monitoring, and experimental research. By providing a means to specifically identify and characterize enzymes, these agents contribute to advancements in fields such as immunology, molecular biology, and clinical diagnostics. Their specificity and selectivity make them invaluable tools in understanding enzyme functions and their implications in biological processes and diseases.

preferred_name.label: IgA, IgD, IgM, IgG, IgE (monoclonal antibody)

definition.text: this classification encompasses a category of biologically derived proteins designed to specifically bind to a particular antigen. These proteins are produced from a single clone of immune cells, leading to the generation of highly specific binding sites. The focus of this classification is on various types of these proteins, which are distinguished by their unique structures and functional roles in immunological responses. They may be utilized in various applications, including diagnostics, therapeutic interventions, and research purposes, each serving to target specific antigens or markers in biological samples. The classification captures the diverse functionalities of these proteins in relation to immune response, disease identification, and treatment strategies, differentiating them from other similar biologically relevant products.

preferred_name.label: Monoclonal antibody for detecting cells expressing kappa or lambda light chains

definition.text: a biopharmaceutical product designed to specifically bind to and identify cells that express either kappa or lambda light chains. This type of agent is utilized in various analytical applications, particularly in immunology and hematology, for the purpose of distinguishing cell populations based on their immunoglobulin light chain expression. The product plays a critical role in research and clinical diagnostics, enabling the assessment of specific cellular characteristics and aiding in the understanding of various biological processes and disease states. It is distinct from other related products that focus on different aspects of cellular identification and characterization.

a proliferation marker is a specialized reagent or substance used to identify and measure the proliferation of specific cell types, typically in the context of immunological assays. This marker facilitates the assessment of cellular growth and division, often utilized in research and clinical diagnostics to evaluate immune responses, cancer progression, or other biological processes. By binding to particular cellular components or expressing specific characteristics, proliferation markers provide valuable insights into the status and behavior of cells under investigation. They are essential tools in various applications, including flow cytometry and immunohistochemistry, aiding in the understanding of cellular dynamics and immune system function.

a reagent specifically designed for the quantification and analysis of stem cells within a biological sample, facilitating the identification and enumeration of these cells through various laboratory techniques. This product is essential for research and clinical applications that require precise measurement of stem cell populations, contributing to studies in regenerative medicine, hematology, and developmental biology. The reagent typically interacts with specific markers on stem cells, enabling their differentiation from other cell types in complex mixtures. Its usage is pivotal in understanding stem cell behavior, potential therapeutic applications, and the development of treatments targeting stem cell-related conditions.

this classification refers to specialized particles utilized in flow cytometry applications, designed to enhance the accuracy and reliability of analytical processes. These particles serve as essential tools for calibrating and optimizing flow cytometers, ensuring precise measurements and interpretations of cellular characteristics. They may be employed to assist in the identification and quantification of specific cell populations, fostering improved experimental outcomes. The defined items are integral in achieving consistent performance across various assays, contributing to the overall quality of laboratory results and advancements in research methodologies.

a specialized reagent utilized in flow cytometry for the determination and analysis of leukocyte populations. This product plays a crucial role in immunophenotyping by enabling the identification and quantification of various types of white blood cells based on their specific surface markers. It is designed to facilitate detailed assessments of immune responses, aiding in both diagnostic and research applications. By providing accurate and reliable data regarding leukocyte characteristics, this reagent supports clinical decision-making and enhances the understanding of immune system dynamics.

a specific reagent utilized in the analysis and classification of lymphocytes through flow cytometry techniques. This product is designed to facilitate the identification and differentiation of various lymphocyte populations based on their unique surface markers. It serves as a control to ensure the accuracy and reliability of flow cytometry results, enabling researchers and clinicians to assess immune responses, diagnose hematological disorders, and monitor therapeutic interventions. The reagent is essential for achieving precise lymphocyte subtyping, contributing to a deeper understanding of immune function and pathology in various health conditions.

this classification encompasses diagnostic tests specifically designed for the rapid detection of infectious diseases caused by the Epstein-Barr virus, which is associated with mononucleosis. These tests utilize immunological methods to identify the presence of specific antibodies or antigens related to the virus in biological samples. They are characterized by their quick turnaround times, allowing for prompt diagnosis and management of the condition. Such tests are essential in clinical settings for differentiating mononucleosis from other infectious diseases, aiding healthcare professionals in making informed decisions regarding treatment and patient care.

this classification encompasses diagnostic tests specifically designed for the rapid detection of Influenza A and/or B viruses. These tests are utilized in clinical settings to facilitate timely diagnosis and management of influenza infections, enabling healthcare providers to make informed decisions regarding treatment and patient care. The rapid nature of these tests allows for quick results, reducing the time between testing and diagnosis, which is crucial in managing infectious diseases. This category is distinct from other similar diagnostic tests that target different infectious agents, ensuring clarity and precision in the classification of medical diagnostic tools.

this classification encompasses diagnostic tests designed for the rapid identification of specific infectious agents through immunological methods. These tests are characterized by their ability to deliver quick results, typically within a short timeframe, facilitating timely clinical decision-making. The focus is on tests that detect antigens, antibodies, or other markers associated with infectious diseases. The offerings within this category vary based on the particular infectious agent being targeted, ensuring versatility in diagnosing a range of health conditions. Each item within this classification is distinguished by its specific application, intended use, and the particular infectious agent it aims to identify, providing essential tools for healthcare providers in managing infectious diseases efficiently.

a rapid diagnostic test designed specifically to detect the presence of the Plasmodium parasite, which is responsible for malaria. This test provides quick results, enabling healthcare professionals to diagnose malaria efficiently and initiate timely treatment. The assay typically utilizes immunological methods to identify specific antigens or antibodies associated with the Plasmodium species. This classification encompasses tests that are distinct from those used for other infectious agents, reflecting the unique characteristics and requirements of malaria diagnosis. The rapid test is crucial for effective disease management, particularly in endemic areas where malaria poses significant public health challenges.

this classification encompasses a range of items used in laboratory settings to ensure the reliability and accuracy of immunochemical assays. These items are designed to provide established benchmarks for measurement and validation in immunochemistry, facilitating the assessment of various biological substances. They play a critical role in quality control by serving as reference points for calibrating instruments and validating test results. This category includes standards and controls specifically tailored for hormones, proteins, and other analytes, ensuring that diagnostic tests yield consistent and interpretable results. The items included are essential for maintaining the integrity of testing processes in immunological diagnostics and monitoring, supporting clinical decisions in patient care.

this classification encompasses substances used for therapeutic drug monitoring and calibration in immunochemistry applications. These substances serve as reference materials that help ensure accuracy and reliability in diagnostic testing processes. They are specifically designed to provide a standardized measure for the quantification and evaluation of drug levels, thereby facilitating precise adjustments in therapeutic regimens. The classification distinguishes these substances from others used in various immunochemical assays, focusing on their unique role in drug monitoring and calibration rather than broader categories of control or standard materials.

this classification encompasses a specialized category related to the monitoring and management of therapeutic drugs and their effects within a clinical or laboratory setting. It includes standards and reference materials used to ensure the accuracy and reliability of immunochemical assays for drug measurement. The focus is on calibrating and controlling the parameters necessary for assessing drug levels in biological samples, which is critical for effective patient management and treatment optimization. This category is distinct in its emphasis on specific therapeutic drug monitoring protocols and control mechanisms, differentiating it from other related classifications that might pertain to hormones, proteins, or other biomarkers.

a calibrator designed to establish a reference point for the measurement of hormones in immunochemical assays. This product serves to ensure the accuracy and reliability of hormone quantification by providing known values that can be compared against test results. It is utilized in various laboratory settings to validate and standardize testing procedures, thereby enhancing the consistency of hormonal analysis. The calibrator can be used in conjunction with other controls and standards to ensure comprehensive quality assurance in hormone testing processes.

this classification encompasses substances or materials specifically designed for the control, calibration, or standardization of hormone measurements in immunochemical assays. These items are critical for ensuring accurate and reliable results in assays that measure hormone levels, facilitating the assessment of physiological or pathological conditions related to hormonal imbalances. They may include reference materials or controls that help validate the performance of testing methods used in clinical or laboratory settings. The classification is distinct from other related categories that focus on different analytes or assay types, emphasizing its unique role in hormone-related diagnostics and research applications.

this classification refers to a specific category of biological substances used in laboratory settings to assess the accuracy and reliability of immunochemical assays. These designated proteins serve as reference materials that are standardized for calibration purposes, ensuring consistency in testing processes. They are essential for quality control in diagnostic laboratories, enabling the evaluation of performance metrics of various assays. Their role is crucial in the detection, quantification, and validation of specific biomarkers in biological samples. This category is distinct from others that focus on different types of standards and controls related to drugs, hormones, cardiac markers, tumor markers, and other related substances, providing a unique focus on proteins designated for calibration in immunochemical testing.

this classification encompasses a category of substances specifically utilized for the verification and validation of analytical methods related to designated proteins within the immunochemistry domain. These materials serve as benchmarks to ensure the accuracy and reliability of testing procedures. They are meticulously characterized and formulated to provide consistent performance when used in laboratory settings, aiding in the standardization of assays. This classification is distinct from other related categories that pertain to various biological markers and controls, focusing specifically on the designated proteins required for precise immunochemical assessments.

this classification encompasses biological substances specifically designed for the quantitative and qualitative assessment of cardiac markers in laboratory settings. These materials are utilized to establish measurement standards and calibrations in immunochemical assays. They ensure the reliability and accuracy of diagnostic tests related to cardiovascular health. Included in this category are both standard substances that provide a reference point for testing and calibrators that adjust the sensitivity and specificity of the assays. The materials are integral to maintaining the integrity of diagnostic procedures, enabling healthcare professionals to make informed decisions based on precise biomarker evaluations.

this classification encompasses substances utilized to assess and ensure the accuracy of testing procedures specifically related to cardiac markers. These substances are essential for maintaining the reliability of immunoassays that measure biochemical markers associated with heart conditions. They are designed to provide a reference point for the calibration and validation of diagnostic tests, thereby facilitating consistent and accurate results in the evaluation of cardiac health. The controls within this category differ from those used for other types of biomarkers, emphasizing their unique role in cardiac diagnostics.

a biological substance used in laboratory settings to detect the presence of tumor-specific markers in biological samples. This type of product serves as a reference point to ensure accurate and reliable test results, providing a standardized method for quantifying tumor markers. These materials are essential in immunochemical assays, enabling healthcare professionals to assess and monitor the progression or regression of certain cancers. They are designed to provide consistency in testing protocols and are critical for ensuring the validity of test outcomes, which can influence patient diagnosis and treatment decisions.

this classification encompasses substances utilized in diagnostic procedures to ensure the accuracy and reliability of tumor marker assays. These controls are essential for validating test results, enabling healthcare professionals to make informed decisions regarding patient diagnosis and treatment. They are designed to mimic the behavior of tumor markers in biological samples, providing a benchmark for comparison during testing. The substances in this category are characterized by their ability to demonstrate the performance of immunochemical methods, ensuring consistent quality and precision in the detection of specific tumor-related biomarkers. They play a crucial role in clinical laboratories, contributing to the overall effectiveness of cancer diagnostics.

this classification encompasses standards and calibrators specifically designed for the measurement and assessment of anemia-related vitamins. These items are essential in immunochemistry to ensure accurate testing and validation of results related to vitamin levels associated with anemia. The focus is on products that facilitate the standardization and calibration processes in laboratory settings, supporting the diagnosis and monitoring of conditions related to vitamin deficiencies impacting anemia. The items classified here differentiate themselves from other standards and controls used for various drugs, hormones, designated proteins, cardiac markers, tumor markers, and autoimmune indicators, thereby highlighting their unique application in the context of anemia and vitamin evaluation.

this classification encompasses products or services specifically designed for the assessment and management of anemia through the use of vitamins. These items play a critical role in immunochemistry applications, particularly in standardization and calibration processes. They are utilized to ensure accuracy and consistency in laboratory testing, aiding healthcare professionals in diagnosing and monitoring conditions related to vitamin deficiency and anemia. The classification distinguishes these items from those related to drug testing, hormone evaluation, and other immunochemical markers, emphasizing their unique application and role in healthcare settings.

this classification is designated for products that serve as reference materials specifically for the assessment and calibration of tests used in the detection and measurement of rheumatoid and autoimmune conditions. These items are essential for ensuring the accuracy and reliability of immunochemical testing methods. They are utilized in laboratory settings to provide a standardized benchmark against which test results can be compared, thereby aiding in the diagnosis and monitoring of autoimmune disorders. This category encompasses both standard reference materials and calibrators, which are critical for maintaining quality control in diagnostic processes involving rheumatoid and autoimmune parameters.

this classification encompasses products designed for the qualitative and quantitative assessment of rheumatoid and autoimmune markers within various biological samples. These items are specifically utilized in immunochemistry applications to ensure accuracy and reliability in testing processes. They serve as reference materials or standards that facilitate the calibration and control of diagnostic tests, enabling healthcare professionals to diagnose and monitor autoimmune conditions. The focus is on the unique characteristics associated with rheumatoid and autoimmune responses, distinguishing them from other types of controls and standards used in different immunological contexts. The products are essential for laboratory settings aimed at delivering precise and consistent analytical results in the field of immunodiagnostics.

this classification pertains to specialized calibrators designed for the quantitative measurement of specific hormones within immunochemical assays. These calibrators are tailored to ensure accurate and reliable results in diagnostic testing by providing known concentrations of particular hormones. They are utilized in laboratory settings to establish a correlation between the test results and the actual hormone levels, thereby facilitating the performance of quality control and standardization in immunoassays. The focus is on individual hormones, allowing for precise assay calibration and enhancing the accuracy of hormonal assessments in various clinical applications.

this category encompasses specialized products or services that are designed for the regulation and measurement of individual hormones. These offerings may include calibrators that are specifically formulated for distinct hormone testing applications. The focus is on ensuring accurate and reliable hormone quantification in various diagnostic contexts. Products in this classification are utilized in laboratory settings to support the assessment of hormonal levels, contributing to the monitoring and management of health conditions related to hormonal imbalances. The items classified here are distinct from other related offerings, emphasizing their unique role in hormone analysis and control.

this classification encompasses a range of controls specifically designed for immunochemistry applications that consist of multiple constituents. These controls are utilized to verify the accuracy and reliability of immunochemical assays, ensuring the correct functioning of laboratory procedures. They serve as benchmarks for testing and calibrating various immunoassays, providing a standardized reference to maintain quality control across different analytical processes. This category is distinct in its focus on multi-constituent formulations, differentiating it from other categories that pertain to single analytes or specific types of tests, thereby catering to a broader analytical scope within the field of immunochemistry.

this classification encompasses a range of analytical substances specifically designed for the examination and evaluation of blood parameters, particularly within the context of cellular components and their characteristics. It includes reagents utilized for various diagnostic assays that assess hematological properties, such as the measurement of red blood cell indices, hemoglobin levels, and cell morphology. Additionally, it covers specialized reagents that facilitate the identification and quantification of specific blood components and conditions. These products are essential for laboratory practices aimed at diagnosing, monitoring, and managing hematological disorders, ensuring accuracy and reliability in test results. This classification excludes reagents associated with coagulation studies, blood grouping, and immunological assays.

a substance specifically designed for use in haematological analysis, typically utilized for processes such as cleaning, diluting, lysing, or serving as sheath fluid. This type of reagent plays a crucial role in preparing samples for examination, ensuring the accuracy and reliability of diagnostic results. It is formulated to interact optimally with cellular components and maintains the integrity of blood samples during testing procedures. This category of reagents is distinguished from other haematology-related products that serve different analytical functions, focusing primarily on the preparatory and supportive roles in haematological assessments.

a specialized reagent designed specifically for the identification and quantification of reticulocytes in a sample, facilitating the assessment of erythropoiesis and anemia diagnosis. This reagent is utilized in hematological analyses to support clinical evaluations of blood conditions, aiding healthcare professionals in monitoring and interpreting reticulocyte counts. It plays a crucial role in differentiating between various hematological disorders and understanding the regenerative capacity of bone marrow in response to anemia or blood loss. This reagent is distinct from other analytical substances used for broader hematology applications, ensuring precise reticulocyte measurement and effective patient management in clinical settings.

this classification encompasses a category of diagnostic agents specifically designed for the quantitative assessment of haemoglobin levels in biological samples. These agents are utilized in various analytical techniques to determine the total haemoglobin present, aiding in the evaluation of patients' oxygen-carrying capacity. The focus is on reagents that facilitate accurate and reliable measurements in clinical settings, differentiating them from other related diagnostic agents that may serve distinct purposes, such as those used for cellular analysis, staining, or blood pressure monitoring. The classification emphasizes the importance of precise haemoglobin determination in the context of hematological assessments and patient care.

this classification pertains to genetic alterations associated with an increased risk of cancer, specifically focusing on the T(14,18) alteration. Such alterations involve changes in the structure or number of chromosomes that have been linked to the development of malignancies. These modifications can affect the expression and regulation of genes involved in cell growth and division, leading to uncontrolled proliferation and tumor formation. This classification is distinct from other known alterations, highlighting the unique characteristics and implications of the T(14,18) change in the context of cancer development and diagnosis. It serves as a critical identifier for research, clinical diagnostics, and the understanding of cancer etiology related to genetic factors.

this classification encompasses alterations in genes or chromosomes that have been identified as contributing to the development of cancer. These alterations may involve mutations, translocations, or other modifications that can lead to uncontrolled cell growth or malignancy. The focus is on acquired changes that are not inherited but rather occur during an individual's lifetime, often due to environmental factors or other influences. This classification serves to categorize various specific alterations recognized in the context of cancer research and diagnostics, facilitating a better understanding of their implications in oncology and personalized medicine.

a specific type of biomarker associated with the identification of alterations that may contribute to cancer development. This category encompasses alterations in telomerase activity or expression that are linked to oncogenic processes. These alterations are pivotal in understanding the mechanisms of tumorigenesis and may play a role in tumor progression and resistance to treatment. This classification is distinct from other related alterations that involve different genes or chromosomal changes associated with malignancies. It serves as a critical component in the diagnosis and monitoring of cancer, providing insights into the genetic underpinnings of the disease.

this classification encompasses specific alterations in genes or chromosomes that are associated with the development of cancer. These alterations can lead to abnormal cellular behavior and contribute to the progression of malignancies. The focus is on identifying and analyzing genetic changes that may serve as biomarkers for diagnosis, prognosis, or therapeutic targets. Each entry within this classification represents a distinct genetic alteration that has been implicated in oncogenesis, providing a framework for understanding their roles in cancer biology. The classification facilitates research, clinical applications, and the development of targeted therapies, enhancing the ability to tailor treatment strategies based on individual genetic profiles.

preferred_name.label: Acquired gene or Chromosome alteration test

definition.text: a diagnostic procedure designed to identify alterations in genes or chromosomes that may influence the development of diseases, particularly those associated with cancer. This test evaluates specific genetic variations that are acquired rather than inherited, providing critical insights into the molecular mechanisms of disease. The results can assist healthcare professionals in determining the appropriate therapeutic strategies and personalized treatment plans for patients. This category encompasses various methodologies and technologies used to detect, analyze, and interpret genetic changes, reflecting the evolving landscape of molecular diagnostics in the context of oncology and related fields.

preferred_name.label: Acquired gene or chromosome alteration (IVD, unspecified)
